adjectives.description: gradual (comparative more gradual, superlative most gradual)

entries.meaning: Proceeding or advancing by small, slow, regular steps or degrees
examples: a gradual increase of knowledge; a gradual decline

entries.meaning: (Christianity) An antiphon or responsory after the epistle, in the Mass, which was sung on the steps, or while the deacon ascended the steps.
(Christianity) A service book containing the musical portions of the Mass.
